text: The filter function allows users to save ECS search settings as a filter. The filter can be loaded to populate the results without manually entering the filter settings every time. Open Creating a filter Searching a filter In the ECS Inspector - Filters page, click on the Search on filter name (search bar) and type in the name of the filter you are searching for. The page will automatically filter the results based on your search conditions. Editing a filter Select a filter that you want to edit. Under the Action column, click the ellipsis button () and select Edit . Make the required changes and click OK to save the modified filter. Deleting a filter Under the Action column, click the ellipsis button () and select Delete . Click Delete to confirm the deletion of the filter. Warning! A deleted filter cannot be recovered. Hint! To delete multiple filters at once, select the checkboxes for all the filters you want to delete in bulk, then click the Delete button.
title: Managing ECS Filters - MediationZone Documentation 9.4 - InfoZone
